reviewText: The course in general is good as is the teacher but the rules for peer review are ridiculous and waste of time. Since this couse is partially based on reviews how is it possible that people are premitted to submit reviews anonymouslly? Worse yet they give one or two word response. As a writer the need for feedback is crucial for learning how to improve your writing skills and if what you write is done well. I don't understand why this practice is allowed. Why would people want to remain anonymous anyway. I am very disappointed and I will be sure to contiue with my complaints on social media.

Although Amity Gaige was awesome at teaching and inspiring me to write (she's my reason for the one star), I may as well have watched similar videos on YouTube for free.The peer-review feedback for this entire specialisation so far has been a waste, and after completing 3 out of 5 of these courses, I have gotten only 1 constructive review - the rest have been one word answers or short lines (one even put full stops for feedback!) from people who seem to just want to get a grade. For aspiring writers, especially if you're hard up for cash, your money may be better spent elsewhere if you are truly interested in developing your skills. If you're simply looking for a certificate, this course is for you.

Highway robbery.  The Course material is good and the assignments are good exercises but $66 dollars for the quality of feedback you get is robbery.  This is the second course I have taken in the specialization.  I initially felt the first course was good but since then I have learnt a lot more about what else  is out there.  On two separate occasions the peer feedback appeared to be written by someone who was new to English.  They were confused about the most basic aspects of my assignments while other reviewers were not. On two other occasions the person providing the feedback simply provided one word three times because this is enough to fool the computer system into believing you have provided feedback and allow you to move on in the course.   For $66 you can get much much much better value in  lots of other places.

The peer reviewed assignments are next to useless, as there is no oversight on them. I think there needs to be a basic comprehension assessment done first, before allowing fellow learners the ability to pass/fail students in the course.

Unfortunately, this course isn't too useful, even for beginners. These courses have a terrible feedback system, people can just write "Okay" or even a letter and that counts as feedback. Passing this course mean absolutely nothing with this feedback system and so the certificate could be earned by anyone at all. The talks between the course teachers with each other are long, boring and just go on and on and  offer at times, little real advice. Why do I need to see previous teachers coming back to talk to the new course teacher for 10-15 mins? Feels a bit like I'm intruding with these teachers chatting to each other about random stuff.

Disclosure:  I opted out of the course after the first week.  This would be a great class for someone who's not familiar with creative writing or hasn't done this type of writing regularly.  As someone who's been writing for a long time I didn't find it particularly helpful.  One of the reading assignments, The Odour of Chrysanthemums, was no longer available to read.  Also I'm not a fan of peer reviewed grading which seems to be inherent in many of the courses on Coursera.

I​ started the course with great enthusiasm. Unfortunately the objective didn't get fulfilled compkletely. Why because I was doing the course to know the strength and weakness of my writings, only through reviews. But the reviews I got for most of the assignments were 'YES',    'OK.',    '...'  like that. Coordinators should seriously consider updating the user interface so that a review will be accepted only if it contain certain number of different words with some meaning. Otherwise it was good

The course itself is good.  The writing assignments are fun and you are given the opportunity to really express yourself though detail and description.  However, the peer grading system is ridiculous.  I would estimate that 80% of the feedback I received on my writing assignments from my "peers" consisted of the following comments: "Yes" or "-" or "lkwffkw"  The majority of the reviewers provided no critique or feedback of any kind on my writing.  How is a learner supposed to improve their craft if the reviewers are too lazy to provide meaningful feedback?  This is true of every module of this specialization and I believe it's a major flaw.  If you are looking to improve your writing skills, don't count on any help or guidance with these courses.

I greatly enjoy the lectures, readings and doing assignments however the feedback system is appalling.  It seems that a very large number of "students" are NOT doing the assignments or the reviews.  They type a single letter or number and click the submit button.  They use the same system for reviews and then they all approve each other's non-submissions. I'm a retired university professor  and have always spent time and effort in teaching and guiding students.  This feedback system is, with rare exceptions not working, It is a good way for the course to gain popularity and money but you might as well auction your certificates to the highest bidders and devise another method of giving feedback to your serious students. By my estimate only about one third of those taking the course are actually doing the very interesting and well planned assignments.

I​ appreciate the effectiveness of the videos in the teaching of this class. I was especially challenged by the assignment to write 350 words about an elapsed time of 10 seconds. It was my greatest learning in this segment of the series.H​owever, there is a serious lack of worthiness in the peer reviews.

Loved the course!  However, the peer reviews are a farce.  Most of the reviews I received were not reviews at all but someone going through the criteria and entering 'yes' or '1' in each grading criteria just to satisfy the requirement.  No actual reviewing being done at all.  Very disappointing.

I would have appreciated direct instructions instead of referring to some books and some time off. You don't get the full benefit of having an instructor when it is taught that way which would work at post-graduate level courses. This being an introductory course I would prefer more hands on instruction.

I got a lot out of the videos and exercises but other course features are not useful... no one participates in discussions and there are no teachers present. Don’t expect to get proper peer reviews. Most students do perfunctory reviews of a word or two just to pass through the automated system. Also, this is NOT an instructor led course... it’s just videos and exercises. It looks like there are supposed to be monitors but I didn’t see any evidence of participation from them. With that said, if you are a self-directed learner you’ll learn.

Honestly I know many of us are frustrated with the poor reviews. Week to week I get at least one good reviewer that actually understands the assignment and provide great feedback, so I’m happy for that. You have to just focus on working on your craft and not be so consumed with the feedback because due to coursera not managing the feedback it will always be lacking in that area. Coursera should group writers week to week so that we can communicate back and forth. That would help with the managing of poor reviews.

One word: Plagiarism. This course was rather inspiring and taught me numerous amounts of skills for my future career. But, the problem was the peer-graded assignments. There were some people who did this course for the certificate and used a skill not taught in this course called: plagiarism. For example, BEHARA SAI SWESHIKA copied off my own assignment, and also plagiarised the instructor's "INSTRUCTIONS'. It was disgusting reading a plagiarised writing piece. Even more, grading my own writing piece that was said that it was written by BEHARA SAI SWESHIKA.
I didn't actually learn anything.  This felt like a waste of time, with largely boring assignments.

The content of this course gives enough basis for aspiring writers to improve the settings and descriptions in their writing. The only improvement I would suggest is to have some input on the student's work from the faculty themselves. I understand that it would be a massive challenge to review all of the work submitted but only peer review feels a bit like a cop-out.

I recently completed the 5-course specialization in creative writing.  For the most part the course material presented was good, especially the courses on plot, on setting, and on style.  The course on characterization was a little vague.  From the syllabus, it looked like it would be a good course, but the instructor did not follow the syllabus and was often very unfocussed in her presentation.The weakness with this specialization is that all the feedback to the writer is provided by peers in the course.  This I found very disappointing.  Many of the other students were honestly very poor writers, and as a result, the feedback I received on my assignments was very superficial.  In addition, rather than being able to learn from reading the writing of others, I found for the most part that the pieces submitted by others were very lacking.If you take this course, know that it will provide you some good information about writing fiction, but the feedback you receive on your assignments will not help you learn.  You will need to find another peer group of writers to help you with that.
Content was great, the app and peer feedback could be improved on

This course was interesting, but I did not find it particularly helpful or insightful.  I felt that everything taught about setting and description was very elementary (I say this as a K-3 teacher who has regularly taught the concepts of setting and description) and not that useful for someone looking to take their writing to a more professional level.

The same as I have written for the other courses in the specialty.   The course information was great and the assignments were very helpful.  What lost points for the course was not the content provided by Wesleyan, which was good, but the poor effort on the part of many of the fellow students to really work on constructive critiques.  For each assignment I had at least one of the three peer reviews that was useless to me to improve my writing, sometimes more.  There should be a way to rate critiques so that students can't move on if they don't do the work of critiquing well.

Just as the Amy Bloom's course, this course has no descriptive arch and one is left to try and grasp the teaching points in a flood of reference material. Teach theory in a clear structure first please then provide reference. See Brando Skyhorse course, very structured.
If you've not read a single book on writing, this class might be good.  Otherwise, don't expect to get much about the ~30 minutes of lecture.

There was great (and abundant) information in this course! I really liked all the quotes, videos, reading material, and assignments that Amity Gaige offered. This was my favorite course so far! I didn’t give this a five star of course because of the peer-graded assignments. This was the majority of my feedback- and I quote, “sgsgsgsgs”.  Very frustrating to work really hard on an assignment and get feedback like that.

T​he instruction and exercises are excellent. The instructor, who's an accomplished author, clearly cares about teaching. The only reason that I don't give a 5 is that the peer feedback process is broken. Most "feedback" consists of "y" or "." or "good." Allowing thoughtless feedback in a creative writing course damages students in two ways. First, you can only improve at anything through the right practice (the instructor designed excellent exercises, so that's covered) and clear coaching. The coaching's completely absent, thus improvement is stunted. Second, one of the best ways to improve as a writer is to put in the hard work of giving thoughtful feedback! Check out the detail that I put into my feedback: I do it for my peers and for myself. By this time there has to be an AI that can run a basic check on what's entered as feedback to ensure that it meets basic criteria.

This is one of the strongest courses in the Wesleyan Creative Writing specialization.  Amity is articulate, well-organized, and an effective teacher.  I appreciated that she actually had students READ examples of effective writing by published authors.

I​ really liked this course.  Amity Gaige has a really engaging teaching style and I really enjoyed the variety of the assignments provided.  My only frustration is with the feedback system used with this and the other creating writing courses in this series; I usually only received one helpful bit of feedback per assignment.  Others will often type simply "yes, okay" or add a few letters to show that they filled in the box.  Not helpful!!

Excellent guidance and prompts. Taking this course helped me push my writing beyond limits, discover new styles to explore and become a more intentional writer. Thank you, Amity Gaige! Thank you, Wesleyan University!
Excellent Course with an engaging professor! I felt progressively challenged by each assignment and gained excellent tips to improve my writing.
I really enjoyed this course and learned a lot. I would have liked more reading samples, especially in weeks 3 and 4, which didn't include any. But I loved the video interviews with authors.

It was a very interesting course for me. I always had insecurities about how I described a place and this gave me lots of cool ideas and exercises to feel more confident in myself while writing. Thanks, Professor Amity Gaige!
This course was good to remind me of the basics for setting and description.
I​ think more examples need to be provided to better understand how to craft a setting and incorporate time
users: María del Pilar Ester Arroyo López

reviewText: This course was quite enlightening, especially for someone who wants to improve their skills in creative writing. Very clear and concise. Valuable pointers to keep in mind when crafting your story. I enjoyed the journeying.

Overall, this course was very informative.  It challenges you to write outside of your comfort zone.  The assignment criteria force you to revise your writing in order to meet the criteria.  Like any online course, this is designed for the individual to learn from the supplemental materials suggested by the instructors.  With over 40,000 people taking the courses, there is no way that you can expect any one-on-one feedback, so it's up to the individual!  One major criticism is that since this is a 'peer' review process, there is no criteria for your 'peers' to provide meaningful feedback!  The major criteria for reviewing others' work is that you be considerate!  Unfortunately, if you are a serious writer-to-be, this doesn't cut it!  If you are paying for these courses, you need to take into consideration the pound of salt you're going to need!  You take these courses to learn on your own and not be spoon-fed to become a writer; your own research capabilities will be well honed if you want to get true value from them.

Loved this course. The assignments were interesting and challenging. Anonymous learner are the annoying, they rarely give useful feedback and take the assignment seriously. This severely diminished the experience.
c​omments on essays were not developped, great content anyway
Too many guest authors.
Great course, it made me discover different aspects for creating a setting that feels alive.
This was one of my favorites.  It helped me understand the importance of observing every detail around me  and unleashed my own style on description.  I really enjoyed it!
very useful and fun
The course was good and Amity Ma'am is a good teacher

I really liked the contents and assignments of the course. It helped me improve my writing. Nevertheless, I think the way peer review is applied in this course needs to be reconsidered. Some people don't seem to take this very seriously or would need more examples of what helpful critiquing is supposed to look like. Unfortunately, this means one doesn't learn much from peer's feedback as quite a few people write just “good” instead of giving real feedback. It's not okay to be able to get a certificate if people don't really do the work that is necessary getting it. Also, it's quite a bummer if you have invested time to write a detailed feedback for someone and get “good” back.
Me ayudó mucho a mejorar mis descripciones. Siempre he tenido problemas con eso, así que estoy muy contento con el resultado.

I am really enjoying the Creative Writing course, having completed 4 sections, which has helped me tremendously in developing my awareness and writing technique and skills. Now,  when I'm reading a book or watching a movie/series, I find myself analyzing the character development, plot structure, etc. My only criticism of this course is the lack of adherence to instructions by peers when reviewing the work of others.  Too often, they simply reply to the review questions with one-word answers. This should somehow be monitored by the course administrators, and they should not receive credit for completing the 3 mandatory reviews in order to proceed with the course, since we as learners rely on constructive feedback.

The exercised were the most fun and challenging part of the course and I learnt a lot but the feedback was a constant issue throughout. A few students do not really review but rush through it. Please get that fixed, the exercises deserve a good response.

I complained originally I did not see the reviews of my work. I did not see them on my telephone APP. but when I checked my Laptop I did.As with all the other courses, I learned a lot from the writers and the modules. It gave me limitations, which forced me to work harder and be more creative.I am quite a reader, so I tried to write as if it would be something I would like to read.The peer reviews are hard to take, even when there is positive feedback, because the teachers here have instructed us all to be kind. Being kind doesn't kill your ego, but you can't be sure whether the critiques are the peers' genuine opinions. The additional challenge in these assignments is to fulfill the requirements in a limited amount of words. This forces us way past our comfort zones, and I, for one, felt myself stumble a bit. So I recommend this course if you are serious about learning and willing to take risks in order to grow.

This was a great course and Amity did a lot to make it as engaging as possible. It stands above most of the other courses in this specialisation due to the fact that there's actually required reading. For some reason 2 of the other courses didn't have this requirement, which seems  little absurd to me. It would have been a 5 star review if not for the pitiful peer review system, which plagues every course in this specialisation.
Awesome course, awesome professors

This was the first course taken in the specialization and I enjoyed the format -- videos, readings, assignments.  One aspect I found a little cumbersome was the peer review process.  The feedback I received was just enough to meet the criteria of conducting a review.  I could have benefited from more useful feedback and I also would have liked to get some 'instructor' feedback, if not on each assignment then perhaps an overall assessment.  The lack of valuable feedback is why I rated this course a 4/5 and not 5/5, otherwise I really enjoyed the course.  Thank you!

It's a good course. I learned a lot. For me the peer reviews are a weakness for a number of reasons: students don't always have the same understanding of the assignments; it would be nice to have feedback from an 'expert' e.g. the course convener; some of the students have a limited knowledge of English which reduces the value of their feedback;

I liked this course and I learned much. The reason I gave 4 stars is that often it is not clearly explained what exactly was requested in an assignment. I saw that its not only me but many other students had a problem to find out the exact assignment. This problem has obviously existed for the last 3 years and was never corrected. I encourage the students to find their answers - at least partly - in the discussion forums.
Good course overall. Assignments are challenging. I think more study material could be added in the course to make it more interesting.
Helped marginally, visible change in my writing. I'm very happy.
In regards to the specialization, I found the Brando Skyhorse course more "technical" but this course seems to evoke talent from students. The peer grading was a pleasure to do. -leattol
The Course is very good. I would like more assignments and tutor's grades

Until now I was hasty, wanting to tell the story - Now I want to show the story through character and setting. I realise the reader is disinterested unless they can walk in the shoes of my characters seeing the landscape as I see it.

I didn't love the videos in this course very much – they just weren't very helpful. They had some interesting thoughts, but for the most part they felt repetitive and for someone who hasn't written much creative writing.However, I really liked the assignments and peer editing. This course challenged me to think about descriptions I wouldn't have otherwise, and made me think more about how the heart of a story is really in the description and setting. I got a lot more out of challenging myself with the assignments and getting surprising feedback than watching the videos.
A good course a lot of learning. Except for the last week when there was nothing in depth. Also the last two assignments overlap??? The first three weeks were otherwise really great.

I really enjoyed this course and the reading selected by Ms. Gauge. One gets the feeling she put a great deal of thought in what she wanted the students to learn. I also enjoyed the writing assignment about the 2nd person POV.
This class was fun and helpful.
This course makes you see your surroundings, it takes you back to your childhood and urges you to gather information from everywhere and tell it in a compelling manner.
this course is really great. it helps you to think out of the box
love the professor n her approach to writing... some of the best n practical exercises I did in writing
At times the assignment title or the assignment itself didn't seem to fit the lesson for the week but the lessons were intriguing and got me thinking and writing!
This was a very solid course. It introduced me to perspectives I hadn't heard before. I think my writing has improved because of the course. I am a lot better at setting my scenes.
It helped me a lot. Has good lesson content

Great exercises and explanations! But I still think the teachers and instructors should be more involved in correcting and giving feedback to student's assignments, opposite the the only student's assignments we can get now.
Great course for getting into the nitty gritty of how your story should feel. Enjoyed it thoroughly.

The course, The Craft of Setting and Description, allows students to delve into the skills needed for polished creative writing. Amity Gaige was a great instructor who provided exercises and lectures that stretched my imagination. I really enjoyed this course.
it's amazing course that gave you a new point of view for writing and a very good training

Ms. Gaige very thoughtfully made it really practical rather than theoretical by bringing in examples of various writings from the past writers, adding in some videos as well for the learners to see it exactly for what something is, while making the points about what should you put into your writing and what you shouldn't. Would have liked a short goodbye video from her at the end though!!
users: Harsha vardhan rao G V S

reviewText: Great knowledge. Time consuming.

The creative writing series of classes have been extremely enjoyable.  The classes are very well organized, the pace of the work was perfect for me.  Wish there were another series of classes I could take.

I thought this course was very well done. The video lectures were very interesting, and the links to additional readings and videos was very welcome. Definitely one of the strongest segments of the creative writing specializations.

The course was inspiring and made me focus on the small details in the environments I create. I think that the professor leans too hard on the quotes and the work of other authors as a core part of the curriculum. It would have been useful to have a breakdown in charts or a checklist to help push our descriptions along. Having said that, the professor seems to care a great deal for her students and that came through clearly.

This class was pretty good. I liked the reading assignments, and there was some helpful instruction as well. I liked learning about the second person perspective, and the section on credibility and research was also really helpful.
This is great course for challenging your perceptions of things and encouraging you to try out different perspectives.
Very good course, thanks!
I enjoyed learning about how to create a vitamin rich unit of fiction and the importance of specific words.

I joined late, much too late to participate in many of the assignments with my busy schedule, but I took notes and read all the required reading. From this course I will take into my writing new, helpful skills. My favorite lesson was setting and description where I learned that the environment should not be described frivolously, but through the emotions and opinions of the character(s) who observe them. Thank you very much for your lessons, Amity Gaige, I'm now not as terrible as I was when I first started.

Excellent course that both informs and inspires. There is a good deal of content as well as advice. The student writer is encouraged to explore and be unafraid. The only draw back is that the online classroom does not allow the auditing students to post and get feedback on their assignments and it must be done externally to fully get the benefit of our fellow students.
I like the course. It's easy and practical to learn. I recommend everyone to enrol.
The course gives great tools to improve the writing skills, and lots of motivation.  Shop talks and video lectures are very attractive and the assignments provide food for thought.

I loved Amity Gaige, the class materials and additional readings. Very very good, but there has to be a better way to grade/give feedback. The lack of feedback is infuriating after spending time writing and editing. You need to tighten up your cyber-security. It looks like people are communicating using Coursera as a portal. Could be extremely dangerous. It is a shame the classes are not monitored and discussions from 2-5 years ago are left in a current 2023 class. Really needs cleaned up. I was also left to review stories from 2018. Would be so much more helpful to be able to communicate with a smaller group of dedicated students.

Best one in the specialization so far. Gently points out various ways to show the bigger picture through the details, brings in a lot of interesting reading and discussions with other writers, and lets us practice all of that with relevant exercises.
A very wonderful course that greatly polished my writing skills as a  beginner
Excelente! Sigo avanzando en mis conocimientos sobre Escritura Creativa.
W​hat an amazing experience! I learnt a lot.
S​uper helpful, opened new  horizons for me.
​I enjoyed this course so much. Wonderful exercises,  the assignments were challenging and thought provoking.
I​ had so much fun with this course. I really honed my writing skills!

This class helped me understand the importance of creating a setting that the reader can identify with.  A good setting will connect the reader to my story.  I've learned a great deal from Amity Gage, Brandon Skyhorse, Amy Bloom and Salvatore Scibona have helped me improve my writing by helping me discover my voice.
A enjoyed this course very much. The teacher comes across as being very knowledgeable and her video classes are fun and engaging.
O​f the 3 thus far, this professor was my favorite. I also found the assignments challenging and helpful to my writing journey.
I really enjoyed this class and the assignements.
​excellent and inspirational teachings - that challenges and makes you think out of the box...

This is an excellent platform for people who want to write but feel they lack the confdence that proper writing training imparts. It is an in depth teaching which opens up your mind about how to write in a way that the reader gets glued to your work and wants to know more and more.
writing skill of this course is delivered and instructed clearly ang the information is useful
I really appreciated the reading assignments that Amity Paige assigned us. The reading truly helped me understand the application of the concepts that she taught us about.
Great course. Amity does a great job about how to explain yhe process to create settings

The reading selections were excellent. I also enjoyed it when the instructor shared student examples of the assignments after we had a chance to do them. This was a very enjoyable class, perhaps the best instruction of the three I've now taken in this specilization. It's good!
It was really helpful.
I enjoyed this course very much as it allowed me to tap in to the personal side of my life that I never go.  Thank you.

Of all the courses I've taken so far in the creative writing specialization, I think this one has definitely been my favorite one. The readings, the assingments, Amity's videos. It was just amazing. Challenging as well! I absolutely loved it
Amity Gaige is a great teacher!
Excellent! I am learning a lot and I am excited with  each class.

Absolutely loved this course. Everything taught here was meaningful, especially the segment about research. Amity has been a lovely instructor and has inculcated my love for creative writing in a much more resonant way.
This was a really beautiful course. Everything was well put together. Highly recommended for those starting out in any form of writing
g​ood course, good instructor
Excellent exercises and very helpful videos

Amity Gaige's instructions, content and videos were of great help to me. It was easy to follow and I enjoyed going through this course. I owe my learnings to her. Thank you so much. You are a wonderful mentor.
A course that makes you dig deep to find the right setting and environment to set your story in.

Ms. Gaige is compelling because she is genuine in communication rather than the slightly pedantic tone of the others in this specialization. I'm not saying that they are poor teachers; all are very useful. But Ms. Gaige does not seem compelled to bring to the student some new, golden insight that although almost ineffable, is critically important. She addresses more practical issues and the more abstract implications for writers in a naturally developing way. The viewer ends up discovering more for oneself - which makes things stick - than with the models and mnemonic lists (Triangle, ABDCE) that one has to make their own connection rather than having it come from the learner. 1,000 thanks Ms. Gaige.
Amazing, you learn how to write persuasively and efficiently for your stories 5/5

This was my favorite writing course in the 4 creative writing classes. The teacher was engaging, articulate and the assignments were challenging. This student felt that the teacher was always one step ahead of this student's thoughts; when she talked in theory that begged a question, it was followed up by a concrete example. Regarding the assignments, some were tough but you got the feeling that the professor was rooting for you to do your best. An excellent class that I would recommend to other writers.

T​hese were effective assignments and the course content from Professor Gaige was productive and creatively organized. I appreciated the short story and video suggestions as a complement to the course material. Writing is still hard but it's getting a smidge easier!
I really learned a ton. I loved the delivery of Amity Gaige and her personal touches on writing.
A+

This gentle lecturer asked for what were, for me, the toughest assignments so far (I've previously completed Plot and Character), possibly because, as a multi-cultural person/identity, my sense of place is rooted in people, no geographies. My top of mind takeaways are the notions of significant detail, of nothing happening nowhere, of authenticity of significant detail through the eyes of the observer - the litmus test. It's also a course I especially treasure, because a few of its assignments helped me remember childhood details I'd thought forgotten.
​i really liked the course. It helped me broaden my understanding of the importance of description and setting. Thank you very much, Amity Gauge!
very helpful
Amity Gaige is insightful and helped me understand setting better. She is also not bad to look at.

F​antastic course, part of a fantastic certification. So practical, doable and understandable, I can't see anyone not being sure of their ability to write fiction after taking it.I highly recommend it.
I love it!
good

I enjoyed the teaching style of Amity Gaige. She came across as laidback and gave plenty of information and food for thought. I liked the way she encouraged students to allow their imagination to have time and space and work for you.

Amity Gage did a great job helping learners to see what good setting and description looked like. Her in-class examples and assignments were excellent. I was frustrated, though, by many peer reviewers who didn't take their role seriously and provided meaningless feedback - single words, like "yes" or even single letters. Is there some way to hold students accountable?
This is my favorite writing course in the Weslyan writing courses. Amity is such a powerful and imaginatively inspiring teacher. Take this course to challenge your senses and elevate your work!

This course helped me very much about the setting and description. This part of creative writing was the most difficult for me and I am so happy that I had the chance to study about it. Thank you Amity!

I'm from Sri Lanka.This course is my first creative writing course in English. It helped me to think more creatively about my writing. I'm not fluent in English. But my peers helped me to build up my writing style and they gave good advises. Thank you very much Wesleyan University and the lecturer. Hope you will introduce more courses like this in future.
I absolutely enjoyed Amity Gaige's style of instruction.  Thank you!

Amity Gaige is excellent. I would join the program just for her. She leads you specifically and shares examples to help you understand better. We are learners and that's what we need- the specifics. Not vague ideas and feels that teachers normally share. I thoroughly enjoyed all the lectures. Most persuasive and easy to understand. Thanks very much. I only wish that the system of grading was different as needs faculty intervention to be more meaningful for the learners.
An amazing course. I totally recommend it to anyone who wants to improve his writing skills.
It was a great course, with very useful videos and lectures. The exercises were perfect to learn new abilities.
This was the toughest course for me, but I learned quite a bit about settings, time, and place in story writing.

I've taken numerous Creative Writing courses over the years- in Community College, in a university. I can honestly say that Wesleyan University's Creative Writing Specialization benefitted me more than any other. Amity Gaige is a rock-solid novelist and a great teacher of all the most important parts of Setting. This course is highly recommended.
One of the best course in Creative Writing specialization.
I've taken quite a few creative writing classes, but I've especially enjoyed this one.
I really enjoyed studying this course. :)
This was outstanding!  I got so much inspiration to dive into description and setting.  One of my favorite in the specialization!

The course was engaging and encouraging. Amiti is a great teacher that motivates and pushes and pulls in the exact amount needed (for me) to motivate for action and still feel confident. Wonderful course.

All the courses in this Creative Writing Sequence have been informative, and what I've learned has transformed my storytelling. Amity Gaige's class, The Craft of Setting and Description, is particularly engaging, and her approach to the craft offers help with visualization, research, POV, and oh-so-much more! I am incredibly grateful this course exists. Thank you, Amity Gaige! I encourage Coursera to add more offerings like this for aspiring authors! I'll subscribe!
I really enjoyed this class and learned a lot from it.
The instructor is excellent.  I would have like to stretch myself a little more in assignments, but overall, I thoroughly enjoyed the entire course and feel it helped me improve my writing.
This was such a wonderful course. I got to learn a lot about strange lands, imaginative description etc. Generally how to set my world and describe it in a convincing manner. I totally recommend it.
Great experience
Very helpful and interesting course taught by an extremely knowledgable professor!! The course expanded my horizons and enhanced my writing abilities!! Thank you!!

This course was really helpful for thinking (and writing) about the setting and description for a story.  A big THANK YOU to Amity Gaige - you clearly put a great deal of thought into how to communicate the topics in this course in a way that new authors could understand and apply them.  I particularly liked the concept of "Imaginative Research" and will use that in all of my future writing.
Thank Teacher.
It is a wonderful course. I like it a lot.
This course it worth the challenging assignments.
This course has taught me so much. I can say that I am a better writer than I was before I enrolled.
Some of the assignments were challenging, and I learned a lot about writing and reading in this course.  Highly recommend for anyone who is interesting in stretching their writing skills.
very good

This course is very entertaining. All the concepts are explained clearly and beautifuly with relevant examples and a nice pace. The exercises are fun to write and really make you put your newly learned concepts to practice. It provides an aspiring writer with valuable tools to create compelling, persuasive stories.
I loved this creative writing course very much and it was a good as well as knowledgeable learning for me. Hope I become more familiar with it

Great course and well taught. This is the 3rd course I finish from the Creative Writing Specialization. My writing has greatly improved as well as my ability to do peer reviews with meaningful observations and critique which I have put into practice in Writing Your First Novel as well (that course is more of  a capstone than a real course though). I STRONGLY recommend this specialization by Wesleyan. I only wish the staff was more involved with the course rather than leaving it as passive income. Congratulations to the instructor on her latest novel.
curso interessante, com bons exemplos e bons exercícios

Amity Gaige keeps the attention of the learner in tact. I did not get distract for even a second in all Video lessons by Amity Gaige. I could feel what she was trying to make us learn. Thank you so much Amity. You are a passionate teacher.
Me hizo tomar conciencia de la importancia del escenario y su descripción.

Of the three courses I've done so far, this was the most challenging.  The assignments had me introspecting on past experiences. I've realized that setting and description is my area of weakness in creative writing and this course showed me how weak I was. But I tried my best and the comments that I got during the per reviews were encouraging. I think having a review from an experienced writer would boost a student's confidence tremendously, so could the creator of the programme please consider it. The tutor, Amity Gaige, did an amazing job leading through the four sessions; she was a tremendous help in preparing us for our weekly assignments. Kudos to you, Amity Gaige.
Fantastic!
Amity Gaige is hands-down the best instructor in this overall specialization. Her assignment are also very creative and helps you learn the craft.
Excelente curso para los escritores amateurs.
Each and every course in the Creative Writing: Specialization is inspiring and made to teach more efficiently than others.
I have a suggestion. The week 4 assignment has blunt questions for peer review. They seem to ask same things over and over.
I had great experience here and the tutor is really nice! Most comments I received here are objective and helpful, I built a little confidence now. Thank you very much.

Leaving a mark in your reader means your story combines all that I learned about accurate setting and description. It's also about creating an authentic reading experience. I enjoyed the course and found new authors to follow/ read.
This was my favourite course in the whole specialization because I love the way Amity Gaige Mam teaches and I enjoyed writing.

I absolutely loved the course and its structure. Special mention to the instructor Amity Gaige who was amazing. The techniques used in the course truly is helpful. I wish the course was longer because I just did not want to stop.
Amity was an excellent teacher and it looks like she really put thought and energy into the lessons.
One of the best online courses. Thank you

Pretty good. Not my favorite Creative Writing subcourse, but certainly an important one. Is more directed to realistic fiction than sci-fi or fantasy  writers but even if you are 100% certain you don't want to write realistic fiction, I would still highly recommend this and say go for it.
I really liked this course. It helped me develop my stories and if your a beginner at writing It breaks down what you have to do to become a great writer.
I really like the course. You are absolutely great as a professor. I like the choice of your assignments. Great Job. love you Divya
This is a great course it teaches you about writing..

Great instructor.  Good suggestions for further reading

I deeply enjoyed this course and I believe that it offers some very helpful feedback into learning about setting and the proper elements/importance of setting. It was a very helpfull course for me and the improvement of my writing. Thank you very much.

I liked the assignments! Some of them were a real challenge.
This course was excellent! The content was clear and actionable, and I really enjoyed the instructor's conversational style and warmth.

wonderful course, the trainer has done her job excellently in presenting the topics

Great course, it taught me things that I would have never learned otherwise, in this course you must take your time, don't rush, because if you do you will miss the most important points of the curse.

The course was very interesting and very helpful. I learned so many things in this course, thanks a lot.

Very descriptive and profound course that touches various aspects of Creative Writing. Amity is a fantastic lecturer and provides valuable insight throughout the course. Thanks for this phenomenal course.
Fantastic course and teacher.

It was by far the best course in this specialization for me. Amity Gaige's teaching methods were lucid and very engaging. She allowed us to act like a sponge and soak in all the gems she had collected over the years. Really a grateful experience.

Sophisticated, enlightening, and very helpful are some of the words with which I can describe this course. I used to dislike having to describe so much, but now I have an insight of what to describe and how to describe only what matters to the story. Amity Gaige is an amazing instructor, and it's impossible not to be engaged with all her activities. I loved the readings which she sent us to do and which amplified our view of the setting in whatever you want to write about.Thank you so much for her and Coursera for offering me this opportunity!
Great teacher and great course!
Simply Amazing. The instructor was very motivational; she asked the right questions and came up with insightful answers.
The best of the first three, outstanding exercises and information.

excellent course, great material and assignments
I enjoyed this course very much; Amity was a great instructor, and I loved how she incorporated some readings into it. I found the course very useful, and only wish it could have been longer.
Very interesting and informative. I liked the teacher's approach to bringing the information to students. I totally recommend this course!
The teacher is really really good - one of the best learning experience so far.

I think it was a wonderful course. Totally worth any writer's time! The instructor is amazing and, the assignments and peer reviews really give an opportunity to the writer to hon their skills! I, personally, was motivated to regularly write and work on my drafts because the video lectures helped me identify a lot of my areas of development. This is my favorite course of this specialization (and craft of style as well).  Everything that the instructors talk about in these courses is very practical when it comes to writing fiction. I can certainly vouch for the fact that after taking these courses, I have improved as a writer. What better can one ask for!

I am not a writer, never thought this would be a path I would follow but Amity helped me dream a dream bigger than when I started! She provided me some more clarity by being insightful, clear, interesting, resourceful and direct . We knew writing entailed grunt hard work, details and focus but she made it seem very achievable. In fact I bought 2 of her books after this. Great job !

I really enjoyed this course! The lecturer gives a great amount of information and advice that feel monitored in the videos in a way, so far this is my favourite course of the specialozation. I really liked being given many reading sources, they served a good example and clarification for what the assignments required.
The best instructor in this course. Teaches with clarity, passion and compassion and sets some of the most complicated, interesting briefs for assignments.

I found this to be better than the first two courses in the specialization. The instruction is detailed, focused and precise, unlike the others. Would highly recommend for those who want to improve their descriptive writing. Excellent!

Out of all of the five courses for Creative Writing, this is my favorite one. Amity Gaige teaches how to use the five senses to describe a physical location in your story. She gives in-depth advice on creating rich descriptive locales by teaching you how to make a reader 'experience' your world through sensuous writing. After learning how to craft a plot and build a character, the next step is to immerse the reader into your world and story. This course teaches you how to do exactly that. I found it very insightful. Thank you, Amity, and thank you Coursera.
I have learned so much and made great progress.  This might be just the beginning for me in an endeavor I have always wanted to explore.  Coursera got me started.  Thank you

It is a wonderful course with challenges to me as a beginning writers, and many takeaways in the assignments.  The instructor not only shared lots of knowledge/skills of writing as a professional fiction writer with 5 senses, but also via the workshop chat to reveal personal tips of other productive writers. I feel I gain more knowledge, writing skills, as well as confidence to keep writing towards the capstone project, and to be enrolled in next course of this great Creative Writing
Informative, helpful and fun.
Insightful. A clear and direct approach to the craft of setting and description
Another great class in the specialization. I have enjoyed them all!
Challenging, very useful course, gives me the confidence to dig into my imagination and improve my writing.

I had to read this one instead of watch it but it was excellent and informative. I fully agree on the topic of treating setting as important as a character in its own right, because of all the media that has really demonstrated this. Spot on advice, love the lessons!

This is an amazing course. I have done previous two courses as well and I find this one to be the best because the assignments are challenging and you can experiment with your writing. I have enjoyed it thoroughly and now I am going on to do the next course. Simply wonderful! And a must for anyone who wants to challenge and improve their descriptive writing.
my writing has improved steadily with

Excellent course, very informative and interactive.  Amity is a wonderful facilitator of the course, her passion and commitment to writing can be sensed in every word of advice she offers.  The course is well-balanced in its offerings, exercises, 1-on-1 discussions and assignments.  Because of this course, I will most likely continue to look at others in this "writing series".Robert Garlington
Thoroughly enjoyed the course. I feel what I have learnt in this course will take my writing to a new level.

I love how Amity explained everything and the assignments and peer responses where wonderful. I got some great feedback and cannot wait to move further with my novel! Thank you everyone, and thank you so much to Amity for taking the time to put together your thoughts into a class!
very helpful

slow motion, significant detail, about genre or style, the perspective of the auto-biography for the contenu; the discussion about the cours among the students; the interview of the others writers was woundeful; also the moment for us the student to think, to meditate, to read, and then to write, all this like the real class.
Engaging! Intelligent! Boosting!
Great course - the challenges presented force you to write better!

Excellent exercises. They really pushed me and challenged me to dive in and develop my ability to write and describe a setting. I feel that my observation in the process of writing has been refined - I pay more attention now to details in the setting while imagining a scene.

The course was excellent as was the teacher.  I learned a great deal about writing and the weekly assignments really helped me as did reviewing peers work and having them review mine.  I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to improve their creative writing.
Each step I take along this specialization gives me more and more to think about. This course continued to expand my knowledge on the writing process and helped me hone my skills a little more.

aworesome course !

I must say we earned this certificate - hard work, interactive and full of bits to chew on. Amity Guage had us participate, think out of the box and on the edge of our creative seats.  Well done and a must take.
I really loved this course and could see where I needed to improve and how to do it. The authors/ instructors were very clear and stimulating and I have been reading THEIR BOOKS, too!!!!

Amity is an excellent guide. The exercises are fun and match the lessons you are taking. I really enjoyed the course and feel it improved my attention to detail in my writing. Professor Gaige is one of the very best teachers that I've had in my entire life. Exccellent course content, instructor and exercises!

I loved this course!

I have learned invaluable skills in creating a setting and description of characters, places, time and location. The course materials were easy to follow, and the assignments were very challenging but overall rewarding.
Another great class! Lectures were insightful, assignments interesting and feedback from classmates helpful.

Deeply insightful and helpful. I am a beginner at writing fiction and the course both gave me techniques I was able to apply and then realise I can actually do this!

I’ve enjoyed this course the most so far (having completed Craft of Plot and Character), perhaps it’s due to a general improvement in my writing through the skills I’ve alredy gained, but I really felt these particular modules were very good and really challenged my imagination. A great course from Amity Gaige who does an excellent job in helping to develop your techniques in setting and description.
It was an enlightening experience. I learnt a great deal. Thank you
Great class. Very informative!
I absolutely loved this course and it taught me how to better describe a setting and where I've gone too much in detail and where I could explore and focus more :) Thanks!
I have learned so much from this course.And this might be the best of the 5 courses

First, Amity is a great teacher.Second, all courses of creative writing gave me much more than the lessons, they gave me wider horizons and confidence.This one was so valuable, it made me learn various styles of telling stories, second person and lastly some secrets of how to create my story world.
This course gave a real depth to the importance of describing your character's environment, as a way of deepening and exciting them. excellent work on imagining your characters in the environment

This particular module helped me to explore the shut passages of my mind and heart. This has been my favorite course of the three I've taken thus far. I really enjoyed the reading material that acted as a demonstration of what we were being expected to write about.The necessity to persuade the reader. I think this is my favourite of the writing courses so far. The first two courses are good, and instruct you what to write. This third course gives instructions on how to write, and I feel I get the most from it.

Another engaging course in this Ceative Writing Specialisation. What I like most is that on the following week the lecture gives a good example of assignment from one of her past students. I wish other lecturers could do the same.
Excellent course- highly recommended. I liked how it tied into other courses in the series as well. I took many notes, and plan on revisiting the course during my writings to refresh some ideas.

This course is awesome, it made me think about setting and description in a whole new way. The material is just great.

Awesome course.Can feel the missing pieces slowly fall together in my writing for every assignment.So happy this and other related courses were made available on Coursera.Will mention the author as well as this course in my first book if I manage to get it published.

This is in my opinion the best one of the specialization so far. It has great references and additional content, readings, videos, etc. related to what's being studied. Gaige's comments are always thoughtful and inspiring. The other courses are all good too, but this one was exceptional.
Very helpful for someone who wants to become a writer!
Like every other course of the Creative Writing Specialization, a profound revelation of the craft, in this case, setting and description.
Best section so far. Amity should have her dog in all lectures.

Gaige is engaging!! Always looked forward to her lectures, her insight, her guests, her analyses and her assignments. The one that was the toughest me turned out to be my best work. The student critiques - which are so helpful and affirming - said as much. Read things like, “This is the best student work submitted,.” Simply means Ms. Gaige teaches well and to every level. Just make sure you give yourself enough time before the due dates so you can edit yourself o your best work!
The course was very well organized and quite challenging.  Each week gave me the opportunity to develop a piece which I have further developed into longer pieces which I am looking at publishing.
Amazing course and instructor! Thank you so much for all your wisdom, the challenging exercises and for an all-round great experience. Looking forward to the Capstone course!

Another excellent course in this program of study for the craft of creative writing, with practical exercises and useful constraints that really helped me to progress my understanding of creative writing and improve my storytelling skills. Suddenly, it's no longer agonising, but easy. Thank you!

The courses in this series have been extremely helpful in focusing my attention on what matters most.  Each component fits nicely, especially the last one. This teacher is the best. Even though I recommemd all courses, I love Amity. She never lets us lose our focus.

excellent
I liked the course very much. It was very useful to give some insights on the importance of description not only to "paint the picture", but to help tell the story. I like it!
I learned a lot
Loved these classes

This is the third course in the specialization.  While I have enjoyed all three modules, I learned the most from this one.The first three weeks are very effectively focused on the course theme, setting and 
description--why it is an essential component of story-telling, what constitutes significant detail, 
and how to "research" to find the detail to include.  The videos in the final week (on genre and historical fiction) wander a bit from the central theme, but are certainly  relevant to issues of setting and description.  The four exercises are interesting and challenging.  In addition, they are nicely varied and all clearly related to the theme.  Amity is a wonderful lecturer and interviewer, and I look forward to reading some of her work.
I think this was my favorite module because it's an area I suffered from. My books are heavy on dialogue and suck in setting. This will change with my next project.
I really enjoyed this course and learned a lot. I also liked the fact that Amity gave selected readings to read which she thought might be important and helpful for us.

Each of the Creative Writing courses in this series has been meaningful and helpful to me as a novice writer. The material, instructors, guest speakers, practice assignments, and forums made learning enjoyable and effective. Most of all, the university and the seasoned professors/writers are inspiring individuals for whom I am eternally grateful!
Amity , i think your the greatest professor ever you made me fall in love with this course
I really like Amity Gaige as an instructor. Her methods are easy to follow, her assignments difficult but not insurmountable, and she talks with a vigor that glues you to her videos.

Really enjoyed this course, even though the assignments were increasingly hard.In the first week there are a few hours of videos, after that only about 1.5 hours of material per week, but it's very concentrated goodness.  The lecturer is very clear and interesting.The assignments are "stretching", and the more you put into them the more you get out.  I also learnt a lot by reviewing other people's work.  The reviews I received were helpful, thoughtful and positive.
Taught me how to slow time down, be more observant, engage all the senses and immerse the reader into the story

Amity is able to convey the abstract concepts that piece together an engaging and fluid composition using examples and exercises that are incredibly helpful to an aspiring writer.  The insight she offers is invaluable and I feel privileged to have been able to access her teachings.  I am looking forward to reading the books she has written.
Excellent class!
Awesome course, excellent instructor. I am a way better writer for it!
Very good

I really enjoyed Amity's style of teaching for this course on The Craft of Setting and Description. Her instruction, examples, and general style of teaching was very well thought-out, deliberate, and specific. One of my weaknesses as a writer, I believe, is around setting and integrating exposition but in a showing way. These exercises were helpful, I had hoped that the feedback from my peers would be more helpful. Some feedback was great, but some was too superficial (did they read it?) or too harsh (wanting to boast their own expertise).
The best parts of this course are faculty as well as the feedback received in peer reviews.

This, for me, has been, by far the best part of the Creative writing course. Amity is an amazing instructor and gives great incite and lessons on Setting and description. She takes it one step further with readings and visualizations. I have learned so much that I can put to use! Highly reccomen

Amity has been the best teacher in this course series. She had us, big gasp, actually READ some wonderful stories and passages. Nothing like a writer reading. Her lectures were spot on and interesting and dynamic. The assignments were clear and fun to complete.  Thank you Amity!

Excellent, of course!  This segment made a huge difference for me. It completely changed how I look at writing in terms of using specific details to describe a setting that fits the mood and movement of what I'm writing. I loved this lesson!
Really informative course that makes you look at what you read more closely.
This was so helpful in getting over significant roadblocks with ongoing work, and getting me to write new work.
good assignments and clear tips and inspirations.

Excellent. I truly enjoyed the content, the tasks, the feedback, and the instructor's ability to engage learners. I perceived Mrs. Gaige as a natural motivator and a great facilitator. Thank you so much for your time. Mrs. Amity Gaige. Sincerely, Maria Barreto

This was a great course. I feel like I learned a lot and was able to expand my writing abilities in ways I never knew I could. I absolutely loved the guided meditation and soundscapes portion of the course.  Thank you, Amity Gaige!

One can tell that Amity Gaige has carefully tailored this course to teach us the craft of setting and description. I have never paid much attention to it before, always connecting much more to the characters' feelings. Only now after taking this course, I can appreciate how important setting and description really is for the reader and also for the characters in your story. Thank you Amity!

The way Amity Gaige passes on her learnings makes it extremely easy for the beginners to pick things up. Her tips on persuasive writing completely persuaded me :). A very well designed course and delivered very well by Amity :)
Interesting information, lots of inspiration and good excercises.
An excellent course under the mentorship of Amity Gaige. She is a gorgeous mentor. I learned a lot of new things! Thank you very much.
I really liked this course because it contained a lot of reading material and made me practice on various aspects of setting writing. My favourite so far.

So far, this is my favorite module. I can tell my writing is improving & am grateful for the thoughtful instruction.  I would like some Instructor input, not just peers, however. That would be an amazing bonus to an already wonderful course!

I enjoyed everything about this course. I found every module extremely helpful along with all of the feedback I received from my peers. The exercises were extremely enjoyable and creative. This has been an excellent course through and through.
Great course that caused me to get out of my comfort zone!
In this course I practiced an exercise that changed forever my way of writing a setting description. I loved it!
Very thought provoking, inspiring and educational.
the most informative and most structured out of all Creative Writing Specialization courses so far. Thank you!
The assignments are challenging and fun to do. I feel like my writing has improved a lot!
Great course. Excellent exercises, and illuminating lessons.
I really liked how the videos set up the assignments and enjoyed the assignments themselves. They worked really well for a couple different projects I'm working on -- so useful and versatile.
Great course!
Excellent course highly recommended.
Amity Gaige quickly became one of my favourite tutors. I enjoyed all the meditation parts so much that it made me rethink how research should be done. Thank you!
The examples and the assignments are very cleverly thought out. Good teaching!
A great course to get you thinking about the what and where of your story. I highly recommend this course.
An excellent course to help you involve in the art of setting and description. I recommend it 100%
excellent course
This was a fun course. I learned aloy about setting.
Amity Gage is an excellent Instructor with helpful tips and information regarding The Craft of Setting and Description.
Excellent course.  I learned a lot. Amity Gaige is a terrific instructor. I enjoyed her method of teaching.
Challenging and very helpful course. I learned so much. Thank you!

Thank you so much Amity for all the knowledge that you have given me. Your approach to teaching is wonderful and I was intrigued by your views on writing. I thoroughly enjoyed learning from you. You are amazing and I feel blessed to have been you as an instructor. Again, thank you!
This course was awesome. Every assignment was really challenging and the classes were so interesting. I think it was the best course in this specialization. Thank you very much to the teacher!
Such a great inspiring teacher. My favourite course on this Platform.
This was a difficult one for me but incredibly useful, I really needed it as a writer in order to create great settings.
Really instructive course and exceptional teaching, discussion boards were a bit barren but maybe that was due to the lack of mentors at the time.

This was an excellent class.  The assignments were specific, challenging, and enjoyable.  I enjoyed the instructor's approach and insight to writing.  Additionally, I found the supplemental materials very helpful.  Finally, sharing past student work with current students helped clarify the subject matter and gave me perspective on the required assignments.  I wish more instructors did that!
Great course and exciting writing assignments! The peer reviews were mostly constructive and the instructor was clear and brought her learnings across. Highly recommended!

It was a great experience. This course enhanced my writing skill to a whole new level. The most important thing is that it was both: challenging and fun.
I would recommended to anyone who wishes to improve their skill as a writer, storyteller, and so on.
You would regret it if you don't enroll on this one. By the way, language is not a excuse. English is not my mother language, and I had a lot of fun with this course. It also improved my writing skill. Grammar is a must.
Cheers!
My favorite of the specialization. Rich in information, challenging and engaging assignments, and nuggets of wisdom.
Thank you.
Great Course!

i recommend this  very enjoyable class , courses and directions for submissions are clear , provides interesting and efficient tools for progression . Teacher s personnality is a passionate and encouraging one . Great experience.
I am thoroughly enjoying this course.  There is the right mix of close reading, difficult assignments and thought provoking conversations with authors.
This one was much more intense, and as such, much more fruitful.
One of the best creative writing courses. Truly enjoyed it!

loved this course, the prompts really got me thinking and writing about things/topics that were different for me. Being forced outside my comfort zone has really gotten me thinking about writing from a different angle and I think that will help so much moving back to my own writing

I've enjoyed "The Craft of Setting and Description." It's given me a good chance to spend some time focusing on the details that matter. I've learned a lot about what to include where setting and description are concerned and what to leave out.  It's been a very good course.
I have learnt so much about description and about power of meditation. I recommend this course for everybody who would like to show his or her world to the Readers.

Creative writing being an art, one may try and describe its constituents but never an entire composition. One such constituent is setting and description. Amity Gaige presents this constituent with rare sensitivity. She recommends inspirational reading materials, and designs challenging assignments that defines the space yet affords freedom to the learner. Additionally, she possesses an effective screen presence.
Gives out clear understanding. The choices of reference  books are interesting, especially 'The Odour of Chrysanthmums'

Amity was nice. I liked the way she presented the materials the the instructions for the assignments. It would be nice to see more feedback from the staff. This is was the majority of the peers were expecting.

I enjoyed the course of setting and description as this is an area I particularly enjoy and so it was a great learning experience and a chance for me to enhance my description and setting skills and Amaity Gaige really gave you a free hand at doing this.

Clear lectures with practical advice, and very good assignments. The assignments in the plot class and the character class were too confusing and structured, but the assignments in the craft of setting class were perfectly designed to help the student practice whatever was taught in the modules. I know it sounds unimportant, but we're here to write, and when we're given awkward assignments, the peer reviews go haywire and the writing quality declines for everyone.I read some of the best work, peer work, in this class and in the style class.
Wow! This is a real good one! And also the extra literature is waaaaaaay to interesting!!
Excelente e inspirador.
Very good and interesting course!
Amity Gaige was a tremendous instructor. It was a very enjoyable course.

I really liked Amity's style- a great presenter, great voice and very encouraging. She also really got into the meat of the subject. And her assignments were a challenge but really enjoyable. I have found out things about my writing in this course!

Great follow-up course to "The Craft of Plot." As a side note, those auditing this creative writing series from Wesleyan University must choose one of their paid routes of they desire to turn in assignments and get feedback from classmates. I guess this is the new course structure for specialized topics on the Coursera platform. The inability to turn in assignments was of little concern to me, but it may disappoint some, so I thought I'd mention it. Otherwise, at the very least, you'll have a firmer understanding and appreciation for crafting detailed settings and descriptions after auditing this course.
More engaging and inspirational than many, many other approaches.
What a great course. It was accessible, but at the same time challenging. Wonderful!
Excellent course: Thank you so much!!!!
